intro: Cyrtandra × kaiholenaensis, commonly known as the hybrid Cyrtandra, is a rare plant native to Hawaii. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and stream banks. It is notable for its unique morphology, including hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
